Replace.Text: Mines provide a minor adjacency bonus for all districts and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Specialty districts do not receive minor adjacency from other districts and cannot be built adjacent to City Center.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide all of [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for technologies. -60% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science in all cities.

Allows coastal raiding for all naval melee units. +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards naval melee units. Pillaging and coastal raiding Mines and Quarries provide [ICON_SCIENCE] Science in addition to [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Pillaging or coastal raiding Plantations and Camps provide [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in addition to [ICON_FAITH] Faith. Gain Viking Longship unique unit with Sailing.

A building unique to Khmer. Replaces Temple building. Allows purchasing Apostles, Gurus, and Inquisitors with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +0.5 [ICON_Culture] Culture per [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in this city. After Flight Technology, +5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is 10 or higher and +5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city [ICON_CITIZEN] Population is 20 or higher.
Receiving declaration of war or liberating a city grants +100% [ICON_Production] Production in all cities for 5 turns.

Non-capital cities within 6 tiles of [ICON_Capital] Capital gain +10% to all yields and receive 1 Builder when settled. Other non-capital cities suffer -10% to all yields. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to units within 6 tiles of [ICON_Capital] Capital.

+2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, and +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art. +50% [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points. Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.

Can declare War of Liberation after Defensive Tactics Civic. Declaring War of Liberation grants +50% [ICON_Production] Production in all cities and +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement to all units for 10 turns.
Receive the final [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet when all other ones are claimed by other civilizations. +2 [ICON_Science] Science from each foreign city following your Religion.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from the Theocracy government.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from the Religious Orders policy.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from the Theocracy government.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from the Religious Orders policy.
Can see through Woods and Rainforest. +50% Experience.
Can move after attacking. Ignores zone of control.
+2 sight range.
Only adjacent enemy units can reveal this unit. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking melee, ranged, and anti-cavalry units.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when having non-ranged combat in districts.
+1 additional attack per turn. Can move after attacking.
+5 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength when attacking land units.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when occupying defensive improvements or districts.
+7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength when attacking land and naval units.
+7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength when attacking district defenses.
Exercise zone of control. Adjacent enemy units receive -3 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against district defenses.
+1 additional attack per turn.
80% less [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength reduction from being injured.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Rainforest, Hills, or Marsh.
Adjacent units that are not anti-cavalry get +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. cavalry.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. anti-cavalry units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking undamaged units.
Formation units inherit [ICON_Movement] Movement. Adjacent units that are not cavalry receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking fortified units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking units in districts.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking damaged units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. cavalry units.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in undamaged state.
+1 additional attack per turn. Can move after attacking.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking units in Woods, Rainforest, Hills, or Reef.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. +1 sight range.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.
Can see through Woods and Rainforest. +50% Experience.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking naval units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking district defenses.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking land units.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking district defenses.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against air attacks.
+2 sight range.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. fighter units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. anti-air defenses.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. bomber units.
+17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking land units that are not cavalry.
+17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking cavalry units.
Can heal after attacking.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. fighter units.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. anti-air defenses.
+17 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking naval units.
+12 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking land units.
+14 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength vs. district defenses.
Launch Military Satellite
Launch Military Satellite
Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to aid military force. All units gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a military satellite into orbit! Provides support to all your units in battle.
Launch Broadcast Satellite
Launch Broadcast Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to improve broadcast service. +5% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a broadcast satellite into orbit! Your cultural programs can be received better around the world.
Launch Communication Satellite
Launch Communication Satellite

Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to establish communication network. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes and +2 [ICON_Production] Production from domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a communication satellite into orbit! Makes trades more profitable with faster flow of information.
Launch Solar Energy Satellite
Launch Solar Energy Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to gather solar energy. Provides +6 [ICON_Power] Power to the city from renewable solar sources. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a solar energy satellite into orbit! Provides clean solar power to this city via microwave transmissions.
Launch Weather Satellite
Launch Weather Satellite

Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to gather weather data. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each Farm and +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each Farm on resource in your empire. Requires 30 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a weather satellite into orbit! Allows your farmers to make better decisions regarding agriculture.
Launch Ecology Satellite
Launch Ecology Satellite

Repeatable Space project which launches a satellite into orbit to maintain ecology in the area. Provides +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to the city. Requires 15 [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum to begin construction.
You've successfully launched a ecology satellite into orbit! Allows sustainable growth by restoring local ecosystem.
Reform the Coinage Golden Age:[NEWLINE]Traders are immune to being plundered. International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold per specialty district in the destination city.

Hic Sunt Dracones Golden Age:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_Citizen] Population for cities settled on different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for naval and embarked units. +3 Loyalty per turn for cities not on your [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

Monumentality Golden Age:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all Builders. Can purchase civilian units with [ICON_Faith] Faith. Builders and Settlers are 20% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_FAITH] Faith and [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Allows harvesting of [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, and [ICON_RESOURCE_MAIZE] Maize.
Allows Builders to embark, and allows harvesting of [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish and [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs.
Allows chopping of Rainforest.
Allows Traders to embark.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Mines.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food on Pastures.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold on Fishing Boats. All naval and embarked units can navigate Ocean tiles.

Provides one more level of diplomatic visibility on all other civilizations. All [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism yields from [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing are doubled.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Quarries.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Mines.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food on Plantations.
Receive [ICON_Tourism] Tourism on all improvements, equal to their [ICON_Culture] Culture output.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every adjacent Farm on Farms. +1 [ICON_Production] Production on Pastures.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Lumber Mills. All cities receive 300 Fortification Strength and are not affected by Siege Towers or Battering Rams.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Quarries.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. +2 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Hydroelectric Dam. +20% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
Unlocks Aircraft Carrier upgrade: Flight Deck (+1 additional aircraft slot), Scout Planes (+1 sight range).
Unlocks Aircraft Carrier upgrade: Hangar Deck (+1 additional aircraft slot), Advanced Engines (+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement).

+1 [ICON_Food] Food on Pastures. Unlocks Aircraft Carrier upgrade: Folding Wings (+1 additional aircraft slot), Deck Crews (Can heal after attacking), Supercarrier (Heal outside of friendly territory.)
Can build Solar Farms on Tundra and Snow.
Can build Offshore Wind Farms on Ocean.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Solar Farms.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Wind Farms.
+1 [ICON_Power] Power per turn to Geothermal Plants.
Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Drone Air Defense (+100 [ICON_AntiAir_Large] Anti-Air Strength).

CO2 emissions from units reduced by 50%. Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Particle Beam Siege Cannon (Ranged attacks against district defenses are 100% effective and gain +30 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength.)
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Mines. Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Reinforced Armor Plating (+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against land and naval units.)
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Lumber Mills. Unlocks Giant Death Robot upgrade: Enhanced Mobility (+3 [ICON_Movement] Movement. Can perform Jump action to cross over mountain.)
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Quarries, Oil Wells, and Offshore Oil Rigs.
Own 2 Trebuchets.
After creating trebuchets you realize that castles are not impregnable â€“ you need a stauncher defense!.
Own 3 Line infantry.
Your armament makers are tired of having to hand craft so many muskets. Perhaps some standardization would help?
Allows creation of [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.
Unlocks the abilities to enforce borders.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food for every 2 adjacent Farms on Farms. +1 [ICON_Food] Food on Plantations.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Food] Food on Camps. Can build Lumber Mills on Rainforest.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production on Fishing Boats.
Can build Farms on Grassland Hills and Plains Hills.
Grants the ability to construct an additional Spy. Allows forming two identical units into a Corps or Fleet.
Can build National Parks. Allows Builders to plant Woods (second-growth). +1 Appeal to original Woods in your empire (old-growth). Receive [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Walls.
Allows forming three identical units into an Army or Armada.
Allows transportation of land units between Airports.
+30% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism across your empire.
